documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
As well as asking, “What is the answer to this new form of the question,” one
may ask, “Is this new question a worthy one to investigate?” This latter ques-
tion  we  investigate  without  further  ado,  thereby  cutting  short  an  infinite
regress.
The new problem has the advantage of drawing a fairly sharp line be-
tween the physical and the intellectual capacities of a man. No engineer
or chemist claims to be able to produce a material which is indistinguish-
able from the human skin. It is
